resources.string: Verify if the choosen number is prime. In maths a number is prime, when the only factors are 1 and itself
Count how much prime numbers, are less then the choosen number

Do the prime factorization of the choosen number. This factoring is an algebrical procedure, that allow to write a number as its numbers prime product. If the choosen number is prime the factoring coincide with itself

Do the Euler function of the choosen number. In maths, the Euler function φ calculate how much numbers, that are coprime with n, there are between 1 and the choosen number n. For example, φ(8)=4 because the coprime numbers with 8 are 4: 1, 3, 5, 7

Calculate the n-th pair of prime twins numbers, where n is the choosen number. In maths two prime numbers are twins if the subtraction between of them is equal to 2. The exeption is the couple (2,3). An example is (5,7) or (11,13) or (821,823)
Calculate the prime number in n-th position, and n is the choosen number
The N-th pair of prime twins numbers is:
The prime number in position N is:
The prime factorization of N is:
No, the number is not prime
